title: Model Schema
description: Standard manifest for saved machine-learning models.

output.title: Model Manifest
output.description: Structured metadata emitted whenever a model is exported.

export_dtg.description: UTC timestamp (ISO 8601) when the model was saved.

initialization_dtg.description: UTC timestamp (ISO-8601) when the ModelManifest object was instantiated.

total_runtime_seconds.description: Elapsed seconds between initialization_dtg and finalization_dtg.

author_organization.description: The name of the organization or institution that developed the model.

contributors.description: A list of individuals who contributed to the model's development.

license.description: The software license under which the model is released.

documentation_link.description: A URL to a research paper, blog post, or other resource for more information.

contact.description: An email address or link for questions and comments.

execution_environment.description: Software and hardware context in which the model was trained.

library_dependencies.description: Map of critical libraries → exact versions (e.g., {"scikit-learn":"1.3.0"}).

operating_system.description: OS name and version the training ran on.

username.description: User account that executed the training script.

cpu.description: The model of the central processing unit (CPU) used for training.

gpu.description: The model of the graphics processing unit (GPU) used for training, if applicable.

ram.description: The total system memory (RAM) available during training (e.g., '16GB').

learning_task.description: High-level learning paradigm the model implements.

data_description.description: Free-text overview of the dataset used for training.

data_schema.description: Map of feature names → expected data types.

feature_names.description: Ordered list of features the model was trained on.

target_variable.description: Name of the label / target column, if applicable.

max_number_trials.description: Maximum number of hyper-parameter search trials allowed.

actual_number_trials.description: Actual number of hyper-parameter search trials run.

dataset_size.description: Total rows in the full dataset.

train_size.description: The number of rows in the final training dataset.

train_splits.description: Number of cross-validation splits on the training dataset.

validation_size.description: The number of rows in the validation dataset, if used.

test_size.description: The number of rows in the hold-out test dataset, if used.

train_hash.description: SHA-256 hash of the final training dataset.

validation_hash.description: SHA-256 hash of the validation dataset, if used.

test_hash.description: SHA-256 hash of the hold-out test dataset, if used.

random_seed.description: Seed used for model training, for reproducibility.

model_version.description: Semantic version of the exported model.

model_description.description: A brief, human-readable summary of the model's purpose and function.

intended_use.description: A clear statement about the model's designed application and business problem.

limitations.description: A description of known limitations, weaknesses, or scenarios where the model may underperform.

model_file_hash.description: SHA-256 hash of the serialized model file.

metrics.description: Key-value map of metric name → value(s) relevant to the learning task.

training_duration_seconds.description: The total time, in seconds, that the model took to train.

validation_duration_seconds.description: The total time, in seconds, that the model took to perform validation.

test_duration_seconds.description: The total time, in seconds, that the model took to run predictions on the test set.

additional_model_properties.description: Arbitrary, user-supplied key-value metadata that applies ONLY to this model (e.g. data-source tags, business unit, reviewer notes, number of clusters, explained variance, noise, etc).

additional_run_properties.description: Arbitrary, user-supplied key-value metadata that applies to the entire training *run* (e.g. CI job URL, git commit hash, ticket ID).
